runs.comm: the first delivery keeps a little low outside the off stump
a swing and a miss outside off. Again it keeps a touch low
fine ball! Moves away from the left-hander, cutting off the seam - encouraging bounce, too, and it beats his loose waft
whacked to the leg-side
that's more like it - Ireland are up and running with a pull over midwicket. Not wonderfully timed, but good enough, and that's four
prodded to mid-off who is deep enough that they steal a single
plays and misses to a little nibbler which moved off the surface. And again, this keeps very low, bouncing before the keeper
pushed out cautiously to the off side
short of a length, punched forcefully but he can't break the ring of steel on the off side
and a swing and a miss outside off! Well, that was heading either to the keeper or over the off side...but he missed it utterly
runs this time, lofting it over cover - will it go for four? Excellent chase by the fielder but he drags it over the line

guided down to third man - this'll be tight, and the bails are whipped off! Porterfield is seriously quick ... and I think he's home. But replays show that he was only just home! Much, much tighter than we thought
comes forward to defend out to cover
onto the front foot, he drives out to the off side
shorter and quicker delivery which he tries to hook, and gets enough bat on it down to fine leg for a smart single
shot! Outside off, he paddles it over short fine-leg's head into no-man's land and gets three. Very well run
oh he's missed out here. And missed out utterly. Wide of the off stump, he flays his hands on it, but mistimes it completely. It sounded like his bat was made of plywood
here he goes - four over extra cover! Again, not brilliantly timed - another teaser for the fielder - but excellent intent showed by them
dabbed to third man
steps outside leg to give himself room, but can't make contact
a fine stop at mid-on prevents four. Mathews is the man, diving to his left to stop a very well timed smack
plays and misses! Just a touch too short to be driving on the front foot, and there was a touch of movement back into the left-hander
shot from Porterfield. Very classy indeed. The off side is fairly packed with fielders but he's place this past point and wide of third man for four. The best-timed shot of Ireland's innings
brilliant from Porterfield - a premeditated sweep, on the full, for four more down to fine-leg
a straight delivery is defended to leg in a hurry
on the leg-stump, comfortably tucked for a single past square leg
again, nicely nurdled to leg for a single
a huge appeal - from every Sri Lankan - but it's not out! A weird reverse sweep straight into the hands of Sangakkara. Can't really see whether he hit it
defended on the back foot
wide down the leg side
flicked to leg
beaten by a cracker! What a ball from Malinga, leaving the left-hander at the very last moment, beating his emphatic slog

fast and straight, fended to point and O'Brien, the non-striker, thinks there's a run but has to scramble back. Oh, but he's twisted his right ankle horribly - he's down and out here. Serious, serious pain and the physio's coming on. Poor bloke is in absolute agony. The boot's off and the physio's moving it left and right - how can that possibly help him? He's still on the ground, now having some strapping applied. He might continue...but I don't know how. The brace is now being applied - he had it on prior to the injury as he's been struggling with his ankle all week
a thick, squirty inside edge
a fast bouncer down the leg side, wided on height, width, everything
sweet stroke, poor ball. On his legs, clipped crisply and powerfully for four
slower yorker, dug out
plays and misses outside off. Another slower ball
half a shout as he's rapped on the pad, trying to work it to leg, but he's outside the line
short, wide and cut hard
defended on the front foot
ooh, a thin inside edge bounces through to the keeper
what a shot! Reverse-swept for four with great power - very nearly six. No sign of his ankle injury there. That was sweetly, wonderfully hit
nudged to leg and he hobbles a single. His ankle is still giving him a lot of pain - tough character this O'Brien
pushed out to the off side. Very slow, loopy delivery to begin with
outside leg, he waits and waits for it on the back foot before dropping it out to the off side
steps forward, flicking to leg and they get a single. They could've had two to a misfield, but...they decide against it
swept hard to deep square leg
cut with a flourish but again just for a single. Good length from Murali, bowling at a good and slowish pace
another very classy reverse hit, rather than a sweep - a shot absolutely chock-full of danger, but superbly played, if not quite as well placed
good, straight delivery and Mathews tears down the pitch to field it himself
paddled down to fine leg, just wide and short of the fielder, so they grab two
wide of the off stump - O'Brien expected that to be wided, but it's not
shot, O'Brien - shot once more. Down the pitch and carves it over extra cover with excellent timing. Authoritative, aggressive strokeplay
they will and they can! A false shot - attempting to flog it over the leg-side - but he gets a thin edge past the keeper for four
full toss and hammered to cover, but a brilliant stop by Dilshan prevents four
ah, top catch by Sangakkara! He is so sharp with the gloves. A fuller delivery, Porterfield went for a cut but got the thinnest of edges to the keeper
ooh - beats him outside off
sweeps, or tries to, but is rapped on the pads. Outside off, though
prodded...just short of short leg! My, that was close
swept behind square. A ferocious, spittle-filled appealed by Murali but he got glove on it
a massive, throaty appeal by Murali - the one where he almost breaks into a cacophonous laugh halfway through, such is his excitement - but that's pitched outside leg and going over the top, I reckon
prodded out to  cover. He wants a single but it's so not on
swept, but not powerfully
shot - great feet movement, flicking it over midwicket. Even better footballing from the fielder on the boundary to prevent four. Great cricket!
cut hard down to third man
White lunges forward inelegantly, blocking to leg

plays and misses outside off. "How was that?" politely inquires Sangakkara after whipping off the bails, but the square-leg umpire is utterly disinterested. Oh - he does refer it, though. What a waste of time. Not out
reverse swept for a single
powerfully smashed to deep midwicket. He got hold of that! Placement was a #fail though
prodded out to the off side
goes for a massive reverse sweep, but it's not nearly as big as Murali's appeal. And second appeal. And third appeal. But it's not-out once, twice, three times a lady
swept once more
beaten! Tried to crack it square but the turn beat him
seriously quick ball! 88mph yorker, just outside off, jabbed out to point nervously
much slower and prodded meekly out to the off side for just a single
another slow ball which beats the batsman's hopeful welly over midwicket - but also beats Sangakkara, though he was beaten by the double bounce
a bouncer, tries to hook but misses...very close to being called a wide
fast, he steps outside leg but can't time his flick
squirted down to third man
four - no! Great stop by the nearly-40-year-old Jayasuriya at third man
hooks...down to fine leg, and this could be the first six. It is! Bosh. That's woken up the Irish fans
crunch! He's smashed this on the up for four!
that's the slowest ball ever seen in cricket. He has loads of time to try and flip it over the keeper's head, but misses it completely
got him this time! White tried to flip him over the leg-side but top-edged it to Sangakkara's left who takes it carefully and safely
bashed down the ground
goes for a huge reverse sweep but is rapped on the back-pad - just outside the line, and Mendis's appeal is rightly turned down
excellent length, nice and quick too, and his back-cut finds third man
got him! That could be curtains for Ireland. Goes for a huge midwicket slog, but top-edges it
another reverse sweep - this is an endemic creeping through Ireland here - but it's wide of the wicketkeeper
flicked to leg
oh well bowled - terrific ball from Mendis, pitching it short and beating O'Brien's charge down the pitch. An easy stumping for Sangakkara
over the wicket, pushed into the offside, can't find the gap
outside edge to short third man, wants the single but it's not on
pushed square this time and it's placed well enough for a second, but Ireland need some boundaries
worked from off stump through midwicket
round the wicket, takes the pad into the leg side and Sangakkara fields
quicker ball, on middle, and all Johnston can do is push it back to Murali
pushed down the pitch, Mendis fields
swung into the leg side, but it just dribbles away for a single
down the pitch and thumps it with a meaty thud down to long off
down the pitch, gets an inside edge into his pad and it bobbles onto the leg side
he's connected with that one, a mighty swing over deep midwicket and the ball ends up in the stands
clubbed down to long off and Johnston sprints back for a second, but it looks a little late for Ireland
brave shot, comes across his stumps and paddles this down to fine leg using the pace on the ball
gone! That's what he's so good at, full and straight as Johnston tried to give himself room and the ball crashes into the base of middle stump
gone first ball, Malinga on a hat-trick...a low full toss, straight and quick again, Botha doesn't get near it as the stumps are demolished
what a delivery, so nearly a hat-trick as Malinga spears in a toe-crushing leg-stump yorker and somehow Cusack manages to get some bat on it...he couldn't really have bowled a better delivery
slower ball outside off, Cusack swings at fresh air
swings down the leg side, loses his line searching for another yorker
ends the over with another brilliant yorker that Cusack again does well to dig out
swings hard and gets a thick outside edge that flies wide of Sangakkara down to third man
tries to paddle this to fine leg but misses and the ball scoots past off stump
another edge, another boundary...he did well to reach that delivery which was full outside off and gets a toe-end to third man
round the wicket, opens the face to a yorker-length ball and guides it to third man for two more
wide full toss outside off, Mooney connects well and drives it square for four more...are Ireland just alive still?
what a time for a no-ball, a front foot one as well, and it's worked through midwicket for two
doesn't really throw everything at it, instead pushes into the off side and keeps the strike for the final over
fired across outside off, Mooney can't make contact
squeezed out through the covers, the sweeper comes round and keeps them to a couple
swift work from Sangakkara as the batsmen try to steal one to the keeper but Cusack was caught well short by the direct hit
low full toss, West gives himself room and edges down to third man
lobbed back over the bowler's head and with superb timing, beats mid-off and mid-on for a late boundary but 11 off one ball isn't going to happen
full on off stump, driven into the covers and Sri Lanka have survived a major scare
